DOCNAME: CASE OF TRPESKI v. "THE FORMER YUGOSLAV REPUBLIC OF MACEDONIA"
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial

TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . He worked in a company for production of chemical products ( “ the employer ” ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE a second - instance commission of ORG ( “ the Fund ” ) declared the applicant completely and permanently incapacitated due to a work - related eye - disease . CARDINAL . NORP In other proceedings that ended with ORG decision of DATE , it was established that the applicant had contracted a work - related eye - disease .

It based its decision on a range of evidence : the expert report of ORG DATE ; its supplement of DATE ; the oral evidence of the ORG 's experts produced on a hearing of DATE ; the statements of CARDINAL co - workers and a physician working with the employer . On DATE ORG quashed ORG this decision instructing the lower court to obtain an alternative expert opinion from a hospital since the ORG 's experts were not eye - disease specialists .

CARDINAL . On DATE the first - instance court dismissed the applicant 's claim again . The alternative expert examination confirmed that the damage to the applicant 's eye could not be regarded as work - related . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's appeal .
